japanese:
（旅行２日目。
　今日から沖縄観光の本番だ）
translation:
(It's the second day of the trip.
 Today is the main day for sightseeing in Okinawa.)

japanese:
（俺たちはまず、ホテルからほど近い大通り――
　国際通りを見て回ることにした）
translation:
(First, we decided to check out Kokusai dori%p-2;――
%p; a major street near our hotel.)

japanese:
へえ……。
なかなか賑やかな通りだな。
translation:
Oh, wow...
Pretty lively street, isn't it?

japanese: なんと言っても那覇のメインストリートですから！
translation: Well, it is the main street of Naha, after all!

japanese:
ここなら、沖縄土産から名物料理まで
なんでも揃っちゃいますよ。
translation:
You can find anything
from Okinawa souvenirs to local cuisine here.

japanese:
確かにいろんな店があるな。
見て回るだけでも充分、楽しめそうだ。
translation:
Indeed, there are so many different shops.
It's enjoyable just to walk around and see everything.

japanese:
フータロー君もまだまだ甘いなぁ。
表側だけ見てるようじゃ、
沖縄の本当の魅力は満喫できないぞ？
translation:
Futaro-kun, you're still quite naive.
If you only look at the surface, you won't be able
to fully appreciate the charm of Okinawa.

japanese: ん？　どういうことだ？
translation: Huh? What do you mean?

japanese:
この通りの路地裏には、昔ながらのお店はもちろん
古民家を改装したお店が結構あるらしいわ。
translation:
There are many old-fashioned shops
and renovated traditional houses
in the narrow roads around this street.

japanese:
そういう細道のこと、
沖縄では『スージグワァ』って言うんだって。
translation: In Okinawa, those roads are called 'sujiguwa.'

japanese: 探せば、そういう通りがいくつもあるみたい。
translation:
If you look for them,
you can find several of these kinds of roads.

japanese:
なるほど。
そっちを見て回るのも面白そうだな。
translation:
I see. It would be interesting
to explore those areas too.

japanese:
時間はたっぷりありますからね。
思う存分、楽しみましょう。
translation:
We have plenty of time,
so let's enjoy ourselves to the fullest.

japanese: それにしても、お前ら、ずいぶんと詳しいな。
translation:
By the way,
you guys seem to know a lot about this place.

japanese:
旅行プランを立てたのは私たちですから。
それくらいは調べていて当然でしょう？
translation:
We planned the travel itinerary,
so it's only natural that we researched beforehand,
right?

japanese:
それもそうか。
で、どこから見て回るんだ？
translation:
I suppose that's true.
So where are we going to explore next?

japanese:
それが、まだ決まってないんですよね。
みんな行ってみたい場所がバラバラでして。
translation:
Well, that hasn't been decided yet.
Everyone wants to go to different places.

japanese:
一応、今日のメインは首里城観光なんですが、
それ以外はさっぱりです。
translation:
Although, the main destination for today
is Shurijo Castle,
but other than that, we have no plans.

japanese: ああ、もう毎度のことだな。
translation: Oh, so same as always.

japanese:
集合時間を決めておいて、
それまでは自由行動でいいのでは？
translation:
I guess we could set a meeting time
and let everyone explore on their own until then.

japanese:
まあ、それが無難か。
時間になったら合流して首里城へ行こう。
translation:
That's a good idea. When it's time,
we'll meet up and head to Shurijo Castle together.

japanese: じゃあ、フー君は私と一緒に見て回りましょ！
translation: Then, Fu-kun, why don't you come explore with me?

japanese:
フータローは私とだよね？
２人で行ってみたい場所があるんだ。
translation:
Futaro, you're with me, okay?
There's a place that the two of us want to go.

japanese:
お、おい！　あんまりくっつくな！
人目もあるんだぞ？
translation:
H-hey! Don't get too close to me!
There are people around, ya know?

japanese: ねえ、ちょっといい？
translation: Hey, can I have a word with you?

japanese: どうしたの、一花？
translation: What's wrong, Ichika?

japanese: 実はさ、私もフータロー君と行きたい所があるんだ。
translation:
Well, it's just that there's a place that I also want 
to go with Futaro-kun.

japanese: はっ？
translation: Huh?

japanese:
別に、そんな驚くことじゃなくない？
自由行動なんだし。
translation:
I mean, it's not really anything
to be surprised about, right?
We have free time, and all that.

japanese:
ええ、そうね。
別に驚くほどのことじゃないわ。
translation:
Yes, that's true.
It's nothing to be that surprised about.

japanese: うん。
translation: Okay.

japanese:
（……なんだ、この流れ。
　まさか……一花まで、なのか？）
translation:
(What's with this situation?
 Could it be...Ichika, too?)

japanese:
（四葉も五月も
　こうなることがわかっていた様子だが……）
translation:
(Yotsuba and Itsuki
 seem to have expected this to happen...)

japanese: （これは、俺以外みんな納得済みってことか）
translation:
(Does that mean everyone else
 is already convinced, except for me?)

japanese:
さて？
フータロー君は誰と一緒に過ごしたいのかな？
translation:
Now then, I wonder who Futaro-kun
wants to spend time with?

japanese: 私と一緒で決まりよね？
translation: Obviously me, right?

japanese: フータロー、一緒に行こう？
translation: Futaro, let's go together, okay?

japanese:
ちょ、ちょっと待ってくれ。
そんな、いきなり言われたって――
translation:
W-wait a minute.
To suddenly say that%p-2;――

japanese: ここで揉めていても仕方ありません。
translation: There's no point in arguing here.

japanese: い、五月？
translation: I-Itsuki?

japanese:
せっかくの時間を無駄にするだけです。
そうでしょう、上杉君。
translation:
We'd just be wasting precious time.
Isn't that right, Uesugi-kun.

japanese: まあ、そうだな。
translation: Well, I guess so.

japanese: では、こうしましょう。
translation: Then, let's do this.

japanese:
上杉君は１人で。
私たちもそれぞれ自由に見て回る。
translation:
Uesugi-kun will be alone.
The rest of us will explore freely.

japanese:
もし、その途中で偶然出会ってしまったら、
そこで一緒に過ごす。
translation:
If we happen to run into each other along the way,
we'll spend time together then.

japanese: この方法が最善だと思いますが、いかがでしょう？
translation: I think this is the best method, what do you think?

japanese:
うん、いいと思うな。
それなら恨みっこなしだよ。
translation:
Yeah, I think it's good.
That way there'll be no hard feelings.

japanese:
なにそれ。
また運に任せろっての？
translation:
What's that supposed to mean?
Are we leaving it up to fate again?

japanese:
……けど、これって実質、
フータロー君が選ぶようなものだよね？
translation:
...But, in essence, this is something
that Futaro-kun will decide, right?

japanese:
確かに。
あの時の、運任せとは全然違う。
translation:
For sure.
It's completely different
from leaving it up to fate, like that time.

japanese: ええ、そういうことです。
translation: Yes, indeed.

japanese: （あの時って……どういうことだ？）
translation: (What do they mean by 'that time'?)

japanese:
じゃあ、私は裏通りに行ってみる。
フータロー、また後で。
translation:
Well then, I'll go check out the back streets.
See you later, Futaro.

japanese: なるほど、そういうことね。
translation: I see. That's how it is, eh.

japanese:
私はこのまま通りの先に行ってみるわ。
フー君、待ってるから。
translation:
I'm going to keep walking down this street.
Fu-kun, I'll be waiting.

japanese:
私、この先にある
琉球ガラスのお店に行きたいと思ってたんだ。
のんびり歩いて行くから。
translation:
I've been wanting to go to the Ryukyu Glass shop
that is further down this street.
I'll take a leisurely stroll there. Just so you know.

japanese:
（３人とも自分の行く場所を言っていった。
　つまり、そこへ来てほしいってことなのか）
translation:
(All three of them have said where they want to go.
 In other words, they want me to follow them?)

japanese:
じゃあ、そういうことらしいので。
またあとで！
translation:
So, that's what's going on, okay?
See ya!

japanese: 四葉、あなたはどこへ？
translation: Yotsuba, where are you going?

japanese: へっ！？
translation: Huh?!

japanese:
ええと、一応、沖縄っぽい食べ物屋さんを
見てみようかなって思ってるけど……。
translation:
Well, I was thinking of checking out a restaurant
that serves Okinawan food, but...

japanese: そうですか。
translation: Is that so?

japanese:
おい五月？
どうなってんだよ。
一花まで、なんなんだ？
translation:
Hey, Itsuki?
What's going on?
What's up with Ichika and everyone?

japanese: あなたの想像通りだと思いますが。
translation: I think it's just what you predicted.

japanese:
想像通りって……。
いや、それより、お前もどういうつもりだ。
translation:
What I predicted...
Nevermind that, you too. What are you planning?

japanese:
こんな提案して、なんでわざわざ
俺に選ばせるようなことを。
translation:
What was the idea of your proposal
to make me choose?

japanese: それも、あなたの想像通りだと思います。
translation: I think that's also what you would predict.

japanese:
これ以上、ここでお話するつもりはありません。
私はお土産を探して回りますので。
お先に失礼します。
translation:
I don't intend to continue this conversation any longer.
I'll be looking for souvenirs, so please excuse me.

japanese: ……行っちまいやがった。
translation: ...She just left.

japanese:
ったく、なんだよ想像通りって。
答えになって――
translation: (What do they mean by 'that time'?)

japanese:
（いや、違う。
　あいつが言いたかったのは、
　答えは俺の中にあるってことじゃないか？）
translation:
(No, it's different.
 Maybe what she meant
 was that the answer is within me?)

japanese:
（本当に俺の想像通りだとしたら……
　五月もまた俺が答えを出すことを求めてる）
translation:
(If it's really what I had predicted...
 Itsuki is also expecting me to find it.)

japanese:
（そうでなければ、あいつが
　こんな面倒くさい提案をするわけがない）
translation:
(Otherwise, there's no way she would've proposed
 something this troublesome.)

japanese:
（その提案にのった他の奴らも、
　五月の意を汲み取ったってことだ）
translation:
(Those who accepted the proposal
 must have understood Itsuki's intentions.)

japanese:
（そして俺は、
　この旅行で自分の答えを見つけようと――）
translation: (And, I'll try to find my own answer on this trip%p-2;――%p;)

japanese:
はぁ……。
確かに五月の言う通りなんだろうが……。
translation:
*sigh*
Itsuki is certainly right, but...

japanese:
なんか、あいつらの掌の上で
踊らされてるみたいな感じがして癪だな。
translation:
I feel like I'm a puppet
dancing in the palms of their hands.
It's so frustrating.

japanese:
（癪だが……。
　ここは、あいつらに感謝しないといけないか）
translation:
(Even though it's beyond frustrating...
 I have to thank them.)

japanese:
（こんな贅沢な舞台を用意してもらってんだ。
　俺が行動しないわけにはいかない）
translation:
(They prepared such a luxurious stage.
 I can't just sit back and do nothing.)
